program_title: Water and Waste Facility Loans and Grants to Alleviate Health Risks for Colonias
program_description: This program helps get safe, reliable drinking water and waste disposal services to low-income communities that face significant health risks.
who_can_apply_1: State and local governments that serve eligible areas
eligible_area_criteria_1: Rural areas and towns with populations of 10,000 or less in areas recognized as Colonias before October 1, 1989
eligible_area_criteria_2: Residents in the area served must face significant health risks resulting from lack of access to - or use of - adequate, affordable water or waste disposal services.
how_funds_can_be_used: Funds can be used to build basic drinking water and waste disposal systems, including systems to handle stormwater drainage.
matching_funds_required: Usually, yes. Partnerships with other federal, state, or local entities are encouraged. However, under some circumstances — and when funding is available — a 100 percent grant is possible.
how_to_get_started_description: Applications are accepted year-round in your local USDA Rural Development office.
who_can_answer_questions_contact_1: You can contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
who_can_answer_questions_contact_2: Participating nonprofits also offer assistance and training. Ask your local RD office if any such organizations exist in your area.
governing_program_1_title: 7 CFR 1777, Water and Waste Facility Loans and Grants to Alleviate Health Risks
note_general_consultation: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
